title: In vitro grafts increase blood flow in infarcted rat hearts

title_detail.value: In vitro grafts increase blood flow in infarcted rat hearts

summary: Advances in stem cell research offer hope for treatments that could help patients regrow heart muscle tissue after heart attacks, a key to patients achieving more complete recoveries. Scientists today report success in creating functional blood vessels in vitro for hearts of rats that had sustained a heart attack.
